head.title: The Way We Live Now: 6-18-00; What They Were Thinking

hedline.hl1: The Way We Live Now: 6-18-00; What They Were Thinking

abstract.p: Julia Percevault-Venegas comments on what she was thinking when photographed while shopping for house (S)

block.p: Julia Percevault-Venegas, Chula Vista, Calif., April 2000

''I was house shopping. My husband and I had separated, so we sold our other house. I was very sad and tense -- it had been very sudden, after 33 years of marriage. There were too many decisions to be made, all by me. It just seemed so overwhelming. I haven't decided if I want to change my last name or keep it. Everything is difficult. The Realtor thought it was a great house. I didn't like it. There's always something personal about a house: you have your own start and your own life in it. In the bathroom, I grabbed my stomach and told myself I really need to lose weight. It's kind of reflexive. I don't really enjoy looking at myself in the mirror. I try to avoid them at all costs. But there is hope. Eventually I will feel very comfortable making decisions all by myself. I feel it now. But I don't think there was hope that day yet.''
